loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a married woman, 50 years old, from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 29 and the youngest is 15 years old. Eleuteria engages in a pottery-making business. She has been in this business for ten years now. Her monthly income is PHP 8,000. This is the source of her income.

Eleuteria is requesting a loan for additional capital for her business. By the help of this loan, she will  be able to buy what she needs for her business and to supplement the other needs of the family. In the future, Eleuteria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: additional capital for her pottery-making business.

loans.name: Fredis Alberto

texts.es: Don Fredis de 57 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia desde hace mas de 25 años siembra maiz y maicillo el cultivo que recoge lo va almacenando en unos graneros que son los que aparecen destras del cliente en la foto, para luego salir a venderlos a los diferentes comercios de granos basicos. Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas va solventando los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años. Don Fredis esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas insumos agricolas como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, entre otras cosas que el necesita para la agricultura ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo, y asi poder seguirle dando lo necesario a su familia sin tener ninguna limitacion
texts.en:
Don Fredis, 57 years old, has been farming and raising cattle for more than 25 years. He cultivates corn and sorghum and stores them in some granaries, which are shown behind him in the photo. Then he goes to sell his crops to different basic grains dealers. With the earnings he obtains from his sales he pays for household expenses. He lives with his wife and children, who are 6, 5 and 2 years of age.

Don Fredis is requesting a loan to purchase more agricultural supplies, such as seeds, compost and fertilizer as well as other farming items that he needs. This is his only source of work and it enables him to continue providing the necessities for his family, without any problems. .

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (seeds, fertilizer, compost, etc.)

loans.name: Aleida

texts.es:
Aleida, de 35 años de edad ,esta casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, vive junto a toda su familia y a su suegro en su casa propia motivo por el cual se esfuerza cada día por sacar adelante a su familia.El trabajo de Aleida consiste en la venta de zapatos , ropa y productos por catálogo . Tiene un local en la casa de su madre en donde ha instalado algunas vitrinas y mostradores en los que exhibe los productos que pone a la venta, comparte dicho local junto a su hermana que se dedica a otro negocio. Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 8 años y desde que se inició lo ha hecho sola pues considera que así se siente más cómoda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad para muchas otras actividades además disfruta de tener contacto directo con la gente ya que es una persona muy sociable. Le agrada innovar y ofrecer productos de calidad que se encuentran a la moda según la temporada, es por eso que siempre tiene clientes y en algun momento espera poder poner una boutique propia bien implementada.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500 soles, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará zapatos, ropa y algunos accesorios como correas y ganchos de cabello para su venta en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Aleida, 35 years old, is married and has three young children.  She lives with her family and father-in-law in her own house and puts in a great effort every day to move her family forward.  Aleida's work is selling shoes, clothes and catalogue products.  She sells out of her mother's house, where she has display windows and cases to exhibit the products she has for sale.  She shares the space with her sister, who has another business.  Aleida has been doing this work for eight years and since she began, she has worked alone as she feels more comfortable this way.  What Aleida likes about her work is it leaves her time to do other things and she enjoys contact with other people, as she is very sociable.  She likes introducing and offering good quality products that are in fashion and in season.  As a result she always has customers and, one day, she hopes to have her own, well-established store.  On this occasion Aleida is applying for a loan of 3500 Nuevo Soles.  She is very grateful for the loan opportunity she is being given and for the financial support, which she needs in ordeer to keep moving forward.

With the loan Aleida will buy shoes, clothes and some accessories such as belts and hairpins to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, belts and more.

loans.name: Zosi

texts.en:
Zosi is 34 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last year, she has earned a living by selling goods at her small retail shop in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 8,520. 

Zosi was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to keep on growing her business so that she may be able to help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fridolino

texts.es:
Fridolino es casado y tiene dos hijos dos varones que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Coripata sector Trinidad Pampa de Los Yungas, una zona rural de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja  en el  cultivo de hortalizas en un terreno que posee y la esposa también trabaja en el cultivo de hortalizas y desyerbado y limpiando las chacras (nombre que se da a las parcelas de tierra cultivada), sus productos los comercializa por la misma zona donde vive  y en la ciudad de La Paz; el lugar de trabajo es un lugar lleno de tierra y polvo, ya que el camino está lleno de tierra, ellos trabajan todos los días de la semana, ambos  colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una motocicleta para movilizarse ya que el lugar de trabajo está situado a una distancia de 10 kilómetros de su casa.
El sueño de Fridolino es poder contar con esta herramienta de trabajo que le facilitará mejorar su producción haciéndola más limpia y le ahorrará tiempo y dinero, pues tiene que esperar por los camiones que pasan para movilizarse y pagar por dicho servicio y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Fridolino is married and has two school-aged sons.  He lives in a home of his own where he has a living room, bedroom, and kitchen.  It's an adobe home with a dirt floor, located in the Coripata zone in the Trinidad Pampa de Los Yungas sector, a rural part of La Paz.

He currently raises vegetables on land that he has.  His wife also works in raising vegetables and weeding and cleaning the fields (planted fields).  He sells his products in the same zone where he lives in La Paz.  The area where he works is filled with dirt and dust.  The road is dirt.  They work every day and both contribute toward their children's services, food, and clothing.

He needs this loan so that he can buy a motorcycle to be able to move around because the work area is located 10 km from his home.

Fridolino's dream is to be able to have this tool that will allow him to improve his production and make it cleaner. This will save him time and money because he has to wait for trucks and pay for their service.  This will help him improve his quality of life.

This will be his first time requesting a loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena lives in Alimanao with her child. She has been a widow for about six years. She carries the burden alone to provide for her child. Her child is still in school and Lorena wants to keep providing a good education to her as her legacy. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. Lorena is asking for additional capital to increase her merchandise. With her loan, she will buy canned goods, eggs, bread and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to keep maintaining good sales from her business to provide for needs of her family and achieve a better life someday.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, eggs, bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Betty Keji

texts.en:
Betty Keji is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 12.  All of them go to school.
Betty Keji runs a general store, and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 ssp to purchase beans, onions, and other items. This is her only source of income.
In five years Betty Keji would like to expand her business.
Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Betty Keji says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like beans, onions, etc

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan tiene 56 años de edad. Cuenta que desde su juventud, su gran pasión siempre fue la ebanistería por lo cual cuando fue mayor de edad se empleo en este sector, adquiriendo conocimientos y experiencia. 
Gracias a su dedicación, sacrificio y años de trabajo, Juan se independizó y montó su propio taller. Hoy lleva 30 años ejerciendo la actividad como independiente, por lo cual se siente satisfecho debido a que el desarrollo de su actividad le ha permitido a su familia gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. 
Juan es un hombre lleno de sueños, uno de ellos es viajar con su esposa al exterior y conocer muchos lugares y brindarle a su hija menor la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad. Sabe que para materializar sus sueños se necesita tiempo y dinero, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de madera con el propósito de aumentar sus venta y generar los recursos que necesita.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old. At a young age, he had always had a great passion for becoming a furniture maker. Upon becoming an adult, he got a job in this trade, which allowed him to gain knowledge and experience.

Thanks to his dedication, sacrifice, and years of work, Juan became independent and established his own workshop. Today he has worked independently in this trade for the past 30 years. He is satisfied with the development of his business and that it has allowed his family to achieve a better quality of life.

Juan is a man who is full of dreams. One of them is to travel abroad with his wife so that they can visit many places. He would also like to give his young daughter the chance to enroll at the university. In order for these dreams to materialize, he knows that he must have both time and money. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy wood so that he can increase his sales and generate the income that he needs.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a youth client from Iraq. He is 19 years old, and married with two children. Amir is the only provider for his family.
Amir owns a small garage where he sells and changes oil for vehicles. He has been in this business since 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Amir now has an employee and is well-known in his surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Amir is requesting a youth loan of $1,800. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his garage. Amir hopes to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his garage.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a single youth client from Iraq. He is 20 years old and lives with six family members, three of whom are employed.
Hamzeh is a baker. He owns a small bakery and specializes in making pastries and bread. He established his business in 2011 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has four employees and has a good reputation in his surrounding area thanks to the special flavor of his dough. 
Hamzeh is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to buy a new oven. He hopes to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to take care of his parents and continue to provide the family income.

loans.use: to buy a new oven.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is a married youth client from Iraq, who is 27 years old with a child. Jawad supports his family while his wife takes care of their child.
Jawad sells fruits and vegetables. He has been in this business since 2010, and has gained good experience in this field. Jawad has one employee. He is well known in his area and has earned the respect of his neighborhood.
Jawad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD in order to renovate his shop. In the future, Jawad hopes to grow his business by opening a second shop to increase his revenues. By increasing his profits, Jawad will easily be able to educate his child and provide all of his needs.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled, who is 29 years old, is a married youth client from Iraq. He has a single child and lives with his big family: eight people, four of whom assist each other in providing the family income.
Khaled owns a small shop where he sells tools and supplies. He has been in this field for more than five years and has established his own business in 2010. Throughout his career, Khaled gained good experience and an excellent reputation since he is the only person who runs a similar business in his area.
Khaled is requesting a youth loan of USD 1,800. He will use this loan to install extra shelves, a display window and signage in his shop. He hopes to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to educate his child and provide for all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to install extra shelves, a display window and signage in his shop.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 52-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has an 11-year-old son. She buys and sells fruit and other crops. She has been in this business for two years. This is her only source of income. 

Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy more crops and fruit to sell. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy more inventory for her business and sell it in her local area.

In the future, Beatriz hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more crops and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Don Jose de 41 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 16 años, siembra maiz, maicillo y hortalizas y los cultivos los va almacenando en el granero que sale detras de él en la foto, con las ventas que obtiene de sus cultivos logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en casa propia. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos ya que con las ganancias que obtiene no logra solventar ese gasto, con la compra de ese fertiliaznte podra tener mejores cultivos y tambien mejores ganacias que le ayudaran en su hogar y poderle dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Don Jose, 41 years of age, has been a farmer for 16 years. He cultivates corn, sorghum and vegetables and stores them in the granary that is seen behind him in the photo. From his crop sales he is able to pay household expenses. He lives with his wife and four children in his own house.

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for his crops because his farm earnings are not sufficient to meet that expense. With the purchase of fertilizer he will be able to have better yields and also improve earnings, which will help his household and enable him to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is 22 years old, single and has no dependents. He runs a small general store and has been in business for three years. Right now his monthly income is 20,000 KES.

This is Sylvester’s second loan from KADET; he successfully paid back the previous one. He is applying for a 70,000 KES loan that he will use to add stock to his shop. He will plow back his anticipated profits into his business.

Sylvester’s dream is to own his own supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 57 years old and is married with children who are school-going. He is from Nyandarua South.

Wilson used his previous loan well and boosted his shop. He also has a farming business and has applied for a loan to enable him to buy seeds and fertilizers to use on his farm. He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy  farm inputs e.g  seeds,  fertilizers, and  insecticides

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married business man and runs a service shop mainly offering motor vehicle electrical repairs and electrical installation on a contractual basis. 

George learnt about Milango through advertisements and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is competition. 

George is applying for a loan of 13,021.20 Kenya Shillings to pay for his child's school fees. He believes that the business has improved enough to allow him to meet the required repayments.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school fees.

loans.name: Rufas

texts.en:
Rufas is 68 years old, married, and they have been blessed with nine children. He hawks household goods from one place to another which is locally known as mali kwa mali and transportation and he has been in business for 19 years. Right now his monthly income from the business is about KES 49,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 100,000 with which he intends to add more stock of maize flour, detergents, bales of wheat flour and soft drinks to sell in his business.

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. This is his sixth loan and he successfully paid his previous loan.

loans.use: to add more stock of maize flour, detergents, bales of wheat flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is 40 years old. She and her fiancee live in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Her boyfriend is a carpenter and they have five children between the ages of 18 and 26 years old,. Only one of the children attends school and two of them live at home. Since 2009, she has been selling food ingredients in the community market. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, pepper, vita, salt etc. for her business. In the future, she plans to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, pepper, vita, salt etc. for her business,

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, a  40-year-old lady from Vihiga County, is a widow with three children. She is a dairy farmer, a business she has done for the past five years with a monthly income of KES. 2,000. 

She has now borrowed her second loan of KES. 5,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase dairy feeds. The profit she earns will be used to buy more dairy cows. 


Her dream is to run a successful dairy business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase  dairy  feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Vivenciana

texts.en:
Viveciana is 59 years old.

To earn a living, she operates a pig business. She has been in this business for over three years, and typically earns approximately 8,000 PHP each sales season.

She wants to increase her business income but her lack of capital hinders her ability to do so. Thus she is asking for a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP for additional working capital. With the loan proceeds, she plans on buying four sacks of feed and vitamins. And as a result, she believes she can generate more net sales that can be used to pay for her daily living expenses.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing additional sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtaivan is a 56-year-old, married man. He lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land.

His wife works at a high school, where her main duty is to hang up clothes after receiving them from students. He has been working as a sentry at the same school where his wife works.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 MNT to grow vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, and cabbage. Growing vegetables will help him feed his family without having to purchase much from outside their home. He explains that he is a very hard-working individual who usually grows vegetables in the spring and harvests the vegetables for sale in the autumn months.

loans.use: to more easily and cheaply feed his family by growing vegetables (e.g., potatoes, carrots, and cabbage)

loans.name: Abduljalil

texts.en:
Abduljalil is a 49-year-old, married man. He and his wife have seven children, most of whom are in school. He explains that, during his childhood, he could not go to school because he had nobody to support him.

To earn a living, he is a food distributor who sells small products. He purchases food items, which he distributes in Taiz by using a tricycle to carry the goods. He came up with this business idea when he was working in a big store with a merchant, who supported him as he started the business with simple, affordable products. The business is the sole source of income supporting him and his large family.

He is seeking a loan in the amount of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more goods, such as like spices and other food items, to meet his clients' demands. With the help of the loan proceeds, he feels that he will be able to generate more profits and to thereby improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to meet customer demands by purchasing additional goods (e.g., spices and other food items)

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is engaged in vegetable-selling. She is 49 years old and blessed with seven children. She wants to send them to school. Although it is difficult to send them all at the same time, she never quits. She works hard to provide for their educational needs. 

Luzviminda is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional products to offer, such as squash, eggplants, string beans, and bananas. She hopes this will become a big contributor to make her business prosper.

loans.use: to buy additional products to offer, such as squash, eggplants, string beans, and bananas.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman, who has three school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has engaged in a tailoring business, operating from the market, where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1976. She has three children, aged 8, 6 and 4 years. Her husband and she cook food to sell in a market, to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. Hai earns about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for five years.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 8,502,000 VND, and she repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make food for her food stall.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for her food stall

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en: Saeed is 27 years old and a single man from Ramallah. He works in a restaurant in the city center of Ramallah. He gets a low salary which barely covers his needs. He is looking to improve his home, especially the kitchen. He does not have enough money for this, so he needs a loan of $1000 from FATEN. His home will be improved and be ready so Saeed and his future wife will live in it. Saeed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing his home

loans.name: Doedoe

texts.en:
Doedoe is 26 years old and lives in Margibi County, where the largest rubber plantation in Liberia is located. She is married and has two children aged three and ten years old, one of whom goes to school while the other stays at home with her. Her husband works for Firestone. 

Doedoe was not fortunate enough to attend school, but she has been in business for the past ten years. She sells rice, pepper, Vita, water and soft drinks in the local market. She is applying for a 15,000 LRD loan through BRAC Liberia to buy more of the same to sell. She hopes to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, Vita, water and soft drinks to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Kipyegon

texts.en:
Kipyegon lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has two children. His primary income sources are milk and eggs, and he has been doing this work for six years.  

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming, "harvesting." His biggest challenge is “unpredictable weather conditions."

Kipyegon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "It is friendly to smallholder farmers."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and he replied, “They are geared towards our well being.”

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Kipyegon replied, “increase sources of income.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kipyegon owns “a cow and poultry,” but does not own “a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.”  

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “a mosquito net,” but does not have “electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.”

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 31 years old. She lives in Akhaltsikhe District with her mother, sister, 11-year-old daughter, and infant nephew. Maia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Maia’s mother. She is working as a cleaner at the local military police station and earns a small salary, which is not enough to feed a five-member family. 

Recently, Maia requested a loan from Credo, to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Maia will start trading. She will purchase clothes and household goods at the wholesale prices from the big market in the capital city, and bring the goods to her district, where she will sell them with a retail price mark-up among the villagers. She will reinvest the profit in the same business, in order to develop her trading activity. This will help her to bring additional income into the family and provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: To start a business, trading in clothes and household goods

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a 42-year-old married man and a father of five children. 

Diego has been in the fishing business for more than ten years now. He works really hard to support the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

Diego is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Diego hopes of making his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest is 28 and the youngest is 13 years old. 

She engages in the fishing business. She has been in this business for five years now, together with her husband. This the source of her income.

Florencia is requesting a loan to buy fish nets, fish hooks, lead sinkers, and floaters. These are the materials used for a better catch. By the help of this loan, she will be able to provide these materials for the improvement in her fishing business. In the future, Florencia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, fish hooks, lead sinkers, and floaters for her fishing business.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 31 years old. He lives in the Gurjaani District with his wife, two daughters and mother.

On several occasions Vakhtang requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. They sell cheese locally. In addition, Vakhtang grows fruits and vegetables, but he barely grows enough to feed his family.

Vakhtang requested a loan from Credo to start a business. His loan request was approved as a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the loan proceeds, Vakhtang would like to purchase calves; after purchasing the calves, he will raise them and fatten them up for future sales. He would also like to use a portion of the loan proceeds to grow maize, which he will sell after the harvest. The Kiva/Credo start-up loan program is designed to provide funding and credit to the country's rural poor, who do not usually have access to credit products because they are regarded as high-risk borrowers due to their low income. Vakhtang is confident that these new business ventures, financed by Kiva/Credo, will enable him to significantly improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and to harvest maize

loans.name: Grace

texts.es: Grace, tiene la edad  de 39 años, está casada, vive sola. Con su crédito pretende hacer la preparación del terreno para hacer la siembra de almácigo de café a inicio de lluvias y comprar de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos del terreno, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer  la siembras  con el objetivo de tener una plantación nueva y con una  densidad de plantas por área de buena calidad, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con esta siembra de cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias a mediano plazo y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and married, but she lives alone.  She intends to use her loan for preparing her land so that she can plant a coffee nursery before the start of the rainy season.  Grace will buy fertilizers, fungicides, and pay for labor that is needed to prepare the land.  In addition, she will buy a few seedlings to sow in order to have a new crop and more plants that are of good quality.  She plans to take advantage of the fertile soil, weather conditions, and other factors that benefit coffee production.  With this new crop, she expects to generate a bit more profit in the midterm and improve her living conditions.  She will be able to invest a little more into her crops, which will help her to accomplish some of her goals.   

This is the first loan that Grace has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any other loans with the state banks.  FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings, fertilizers, fungicides, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Itara Women's Group

texts.en: Harriet, aged 36 years, is a resident of Rubaya village in Mbarara district. She dropped out of school after senior four and got married at the age of 18. At the age of 25 with 3 children, she divorced because of being battered by her husband. She started up a small business of tailoring in order to survive and also to cater for her children. This business grew and helped her to sustain her father’s family and supporting education for her young brothers. She later obtained a loan of 500,000 from Ugafode which has helped her to prosper, and this inspired her to mobilize women of her age to form a development group called Itara Women. This group has also succeeded in other developmental projects and is requesting a loan to help them increase the working capital for their different businesses. Harriet will use the loan to buy another sewing machine to create employment for one of her nieces.This will also help to increase her efficiency and therefore an increase in income. She is a hard-working and creative woman who delights in the development of others.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Development Consideration Group

texts.en: Justus is a married 31-year-old and a resident of one of the rural outskirts. He has two children one of whom attends school. He started up a small business dealing in agricultural produce about 4 years ago. After which he started up a retail shop in order to increase his income. He has decided to take up a group loan of 500,000 UGX for the purpose of buying a fridge so that he can serve his customers cold drinks and also preserved foods. This will help him to become more competitive and therefore increase his income. He is going to buy stock for the Easter season. His main clients are the neighboring community members. He plans to buy a plot of land and a house for his family in order to reduce the expenses of rent which in turn can help him increase his savings. The largest challenge is competition from his neighboring retailers.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to have cold beverages and preserve food items.

loans.name: Mlaa

texts.en:
Mlaa has operated a retail shop in her home for the past years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour to her neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by debtors in her business. Mlaa dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. She said she appreciates the previous Kiva loan, which boosted her business.

With the KES 50,000 from this new loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lendou Lom Group

texts.en:
Chinlhing is married and she has six kids. She lives in a village with her husband and her kids. Her husband is a daily wage earner and he also serves as an executive member in the Village Authority Board. Chinlhing is the featured borrower of the Lendou Lom group and she is pictured with her hand raised. 

She used to raised pigs and sell them when they were fully grown. She talks of her experiences and all the difficulties she faced while raising pigs. There were times when contagious diseases infected the pigs and, since she could not afford standard treatment, the animals had to be slaughtered to prevent the spread of disease. It is a big loss for people like her, because the pigs were bought with a loan which has to be repaid even if the pigs die. So she decided to quit the piggery and start a new business.

She wants to start a garment-selling business by taking out a loan. She will get used clothes from the city and sell them in the village and in the neighbouring villages. She has decided to start this clothes-selling business because the town market is far from the villages and she can get the advantage of selling door to door or from one village to another village. She wishes to buy a refrigerator, a medium sized bed and vanity table for the family at the end of the year if she can make some savings from the business.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in income generation activities like Dukan, poultry, cattle rearing, and vegetable selling business. The profits that they made are used for family expenses.

She wishes Kiva a successful journey and a great accomplishment ahead.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and sell them.

loans.name: Sephanie

texts.en:
Sephanie is a 25-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two children. They are both cooperating together to live a respectable life and offer their children whatever is needed. 

Sephanie has been working as a beautician from home. She also has a tattoo machine. She welcomes customers to provide them with beauty services such as manicures, makeup, tattoos, etc. 

Today, Sephanie is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renew her beauty products and supplies. She intends to enhance her work operations by offering her clients high-quality services. This will satisfy their demands and keep them loyal to her. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to renew her beauty products and supplies.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 29 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic man. He is an employer, who puts all of his efforts into getting ahead. 

Unfortunately, his salary isn't enough to improve conditions for his family. He likes to watch movies and news in his spare time and keep foods and soft drinks in the cold, but he is not able to due to lack of money. 

So, he has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a television and a refrigerator to use in the house. He hopes to buy a car and a big house.

loans.use: to buy a television and a refrigerator to use in the house.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
Johnbosco is a trained teacher from Rubindi, a suburb in Mbarara district. He holds a diploma in primary education, but after his studies he could not find a job. He decided to start a nursery school in his village for the unprivileged children. This school is developing and creating a great impact in his village by transforming the lives of the poor through provision of education at a lower cost to their children.

Johnbosco is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 shillings to buy chairs so that the pupils can comfortably sit in their different classrooms. He is confident the school will pick up such that he can adequately serve the community.

loans.use: To buy chairs for the school.

loans.name: Norafil

texts.en:
This is Norafil. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the ingredients that she needed. Her business has been running for two years now. Aside from her food stall, she also has a side car for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses and needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients and supplies -- for example, rice, pork, chicken and vegetables -- for making foods to sell. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norafil hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories about her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and supplies to use in her business, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia lives at Caggay with her spouse and two young-aged children. She has a small bakery business, which she and her spouse manage to earn a living. 

Cynthia wanted to keep improving their output so that all her customers will be satisfied with the delicious foods they sell. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy flour and margarine to use in the bakery. 

Someday, Cynthia hopes to keep improving sales and income to further develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy flour and margarine to use in the bakery.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a recurring client with Yehu Microfinance for a second loan. She says thanks for the previous loan, as she was able to expand her business and increase her monthly profits.

With this loan, Saumu wants to purchase spare parts for repairing the grinding machine. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for repairing the grinding machine.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
This is Fatima. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase used clothes. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. Now she is focused on her variety store.

Fatima would like to apply for another loan, this time for 50,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Fatima hopes to have more loyal customers and dreams of the continuous success of her business. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma es una mujer casada madre de 3 hijos que habita en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar donde tienen muchos años de ser comerciante, pues desde muy joven comenzó vendiendo artículos entre amigas y hoy los distribuye a otros departamentos de Colombia, porque su clientela ha crecido. Hace 9 años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización mediante la cual ha logrado crecer, pues de ser vendedora directa solamente ha pasado a tener un equipo de asesores comerciales en diferentes barrios de la ciudad y en otros departamentos. Su meta mas adelante es finalizar las adecuaciones a su vivienda y convertirse en nacionalmente en la mejor comerciante de sus productos. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen productos en promoción, lo que  aumentará sus ventas y obtendrá mayores ganancias, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Norma is a married woman and the mother of three children. She lives in the city of Cartagena, a place where she has worked as a merchant for many years. At a young age, she began selling merchandise to her friends and now she distributes products to other departments within Colombia because her clientele has grown. Nine years ago, Norma joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped her to grow. She currently handles direct sales by herself, but over time she would like to have a team of salespeople in different neighborhoods of the city and in other departments. Her goals going forward are to finish the renovations to her house and to become the best salesperson of her products on a national level.

Norma is now applying for her first Kiva loan so that she can purchase a large volume of products through a promotion. This will increase her sales and generate more profits, thus turning her Kiva loan into a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of cosmetics through a promotion.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Maria de 54 años de edad se dedica a la elaboracion de tamales desde hace 19 años en su lugar de residencia, es una mujer responsable en su hogar y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboracion de sus tamales como hoja de huerta que sirve para embolverlos asi como sale en la fotografia, vegetales, pollo, maiz entre otras cosas y asi seguir vendiendolos ya que tiene mucha clientela, y poder tener mejores ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar y seguirle dando lo mejor a su familia con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Doña Maria, 54 years old, has been making tamales for 19 years in her place of residence.  She is a woman who is responsible in her home and hardworking. She lives in her own house with her husband and children.

She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase all she needs to make tamales, such as banana leaves used to wrap them, as seen in the photograph, vegetables, chicken, and corn among other things, and continue selling them because she has many customers. Thus, she will be able to earn more to pay for household expenses and continue, with her husband’s help, to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase products (corn, vegetables, chicken, etc) to make tamales.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother of four children and only three of her children go to school.  She has a pub and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and sodas and jerrycans of local gin.  She generates additional income from selling charcoal.  

Teopista works from her home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis only, seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.  She is aspiring of owning a fully-stocked pub and also of becoming a wholesaler of beer. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to improve on  her standard of living. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity and schoolfees .

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and sodas and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Vilgister

texts.en:
Vilgister is a 48-year-old lady from Migori. She is married to Michael, and they have four children aged 24, 18, 12 and 6 years old respectively.

Vilgister is a dairy farmer, a business she has done for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES. 9,500. She has now borrowed her sixth loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase another dairy cow. 

The profits she earns will be used to buy dairy feeds and repay her loan. Her dream is to run a successful dairy business and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nhat

texts.en:
Nhat was born in 1957. She has two children who have their own families. Nhat has wisdom. She raises chickens and grows rice to earn a living. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 30 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 2,000,000 VND per month. 

Nhat has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 2,834,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 3,706,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She wants to use her profit to buy more baby chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase new spare parts to repair her sewing machine and purchase sewing threads and cloth materials. Lilian is grateful of the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts to repair her sewing machine and purchase sewing threads and cloth materials.

loans.name: Abeishemwe Tukore Group

texts.en: Ignitius is a married man with two children, in addition to taking care of his two sisters. Ignitius sells fruits like pineapples, pawpaws, oranges and watermelons to earn a living. He sells these on a busy street on the city outskirts. He works 13 hours each day, all the days of the week, in order to break even. His main challenges are fluctuation in prices as well as poor transport which affects the perishable fruits. He hopes to venture into poultry to supplement his strained income. The client will use this loan as a top up to acquire a small piece of land neighboring him. This will increase the piece of land on which he grows the fruits. He is a hard-working man. The group supports each other to foster community development. The second person from the left to right at the back is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To complete payment on a piece of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, merchandise for her store, and to pay off a debt with another institution.

loans.name: Jose Moises

texts.es: Don Jose de 32 años de edad se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijol desde hace 10 años las siembras que recoge las va almacenando en los graneros que estan detras de él en la foto, para luego salirlos a comercializar y con las ventas que hace logra sacar una buena ganancia que le ayuda con los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 13, 10, 9, 6, 4 años todos estudian actualmente, el solicta un credito que le ayude a comprar mas insumos agricolas como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas y otras cosas que le ayudaran a tener una mejor cosecha, para obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguirle dando a su familia lo necesario sin tener alguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old. For the past ten years he has earned a living cultivating corn and beans. He stores his harvests in the granaries that are behind him in the photo. The harvests are later removed for sale. The good profit he has been able to make from the sales help cover his household expenses. 

He lives with his wife and their 5 children aged 13, 10, 9, 6, and 4. All of his children are currently studying.

He is requesting a loan to help buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, compost, seeds and other things that will improve his harvest. This way he will make a higher profit and be able to continue providing his family with all of their necessities without limit.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers, etc.).

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Blas está en su ciclo número 14. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permitirá saber cómo están sus ingresos. 4 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, tienen muy bajos ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lourdes, quien en su encuesta mostró estar en un nivel medio. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre hace muy buenas comidas. Lourdes comenta que quiere seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan y también para mejorar su economía.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, huevo, harina y demás, para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, y también para poder seguir haciendo las delicias para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'San Blas' group are on their fourteenth loan cycle. They all completed the poverty stoplight survey which lets them rate their incomes.  Four of the group's members live below the poverty line which means they have very low income.

One of the members of this group is Lourdes who, when she completed the survey, was shown to be at an intermediate level.  She says that her business is selling all kinds of food.  She has gained a very good customer base as she always prepares very good food.  Lourdes comments that she would like to continue working hard so that she can provide her family with what they need and improve their financial situation.

Lourdes is requesting this loan to invest in buying meat, condiments, vegetables, eggs, flour, etc. so that she can continue preparing the food that she sells and continue pleasing her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, eggs, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras; está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les permite saber la situación económica de cada una, donde casi todas las integrantes ya lograron superar la línea de pobreza; a través de las Capacitaciones del Plan de Negocios y Técnica en Ventas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa quien en su última encuesta mostró estar en un nivel medio. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene una despensa mas solida luego de contar con los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya, también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace, ya que se esfuerza siempre al máximo por crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita este crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, fideo, aceite, leche, bebidas en general; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras group is in its ninth loan cycle in the program of the women's committee, in which they all work and help each other mutually to get ahead.  They're doing the poverty-elimination survey, which allows them to determine each one's economic situation.  Almost all the members already managed to get above the poverty line through the business plan and sales techniques trainings.

One of the members is Luisa, who came out at the middle level in her last survey.  She says that, because of all her work, she has a stronger store after having the loans from Fundación Paraguaya.  The work she does should also be highlighted because she always makes the maximum effort to grow and get ahead.

She's requesting this loan to buy flour, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, beverages, and other things.  This will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Empezó vendiendo a sus amigos los articulos de hogar, luego comenzó a vender en el mercado y pudo capitalizarse y comprar los artículos para el lugar le gusta su trabajo. Trabaja sola de 9h00 a 20h00.

Vende artículos de hogar como tostadoras las comprar a $15 y las vende a $24, batidoras las comprar a las $16 y las vende a $25, ollas las comprar a $22 y las vende a $35. Su enfermedad no le permite trabajar  normalmente en negocio ya que ella es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida). No es casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar articulos de hogar como batidoras, licuadoras, electrodomesticos para asi tener mas ingresos con las ventas. Su sueño es poder expandir y tener una red de vendedores compartir junto a su familia y darles una vida digna
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. She began selling household goods to her friends, but later on she began selling at the market. This enabled her to build up capital so that she could buy merchandise. She enjoys her job and works alone from 9:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M.

The borrower sells household goods. These include toasters that she buys for $15 and sells for $24, mixers that she buys for $16 and sells for $25, and cookware that she buys for $22 and sells for $35. Her illness does not allow her to work at her business on a normal basis. She is a patient who is living with HIV/AIDS. The borrower is not married and has a one-year-old child.

With this loan, she wants to buy household goods such as mixers, blenders, and other electric appliances so that she can generate more profit from her sales. Her dreams include expanding and building a network of salespeople, spending time with her family, and providing them with a decent life.

loans.use: to buy mixers, blenders, and other appliances.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Mi propósito es incrementar los ingresos de mi pequeño negocio para sacar adelante a mi familia", fueron las palabras de José al momento de solicitar el crédito. 

El Sr. José nació en la ciudad de Matehuala, en el estado de San Luís Potosí, México.  A los 18 años dejó a sus padres para emigrar  a Monterrey, Nuevo León, buscando un mejor porvenir. Llegó a la ciudad a vivir con unos tíos, quienes le ayudaron a conseguir su primer trabajo en una granja, donde estuvo laborando durante 4 años como Ayudante.   Después de esto, consiguió un nuevo empleo como Ayudante Eléctrico, donde estuvo trabajando por otros 4 años y en ese lapso conoció a Juana Maria con quien contrajo matrimonio y quienes procrearon 2 hijos. Con esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposa, pudo construir su humilde casita donde actualmente viven con mucha humildad.

Pasó el tiempo y José se dio cuenta que cada vez eran mayores las necesidades de su familia por lo que decidió rentar un terreno y estableció un pequeño negocio, compra-venta de refacciones usadas para automóviles, pero le ha faltado capital para desarrollar el negocio que pueda adquirir inventario y obtener mayores ingresos. Entonces José buscó alguna alternativa para conseguir un crédito que le pudiera ayudar y se encontró con Credituyo, con quienes se siente muy agradecido por otorgarle esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
"My intention is to increase the revenue of my small business to take care of my family," were the words of José upon requesting the loan.

José was born in the city of Matehuala, in the state of San Luís Potosí, in Mexico. At 18 years old, he left his parents to emigrate to Monterrey, Nuevo León, in search of a better future. He arrived in the city to live with some relatives who helped him to get his first job on a farm where he worked as a farmhand for four years. After that, he got a new job as a electrician's assistant, which he did for another four years. During that time, he met Juana María, with whom he got married and had two children. With great effort and the help of his wife, he was able to build their modest little house where they currently live quite humbly.

Time passed, and José realized that his family's needs were greater all the time, so he decided to rent a lot and establish a small business buying and selling used auto parts. However, he has been lacking the business development capital that would enable him to acquire inventory and increase his revenue. So José went looking for an alternative to take out a loan that could help him; he found Credituyo, to whom he feels very grateful for granting him this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his used auto parts business

loans.name: Kokuere Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kokuere está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza,  el cual es un medio que les ayuda a saber en qué situación económica están las miembros del grupo.
Soraida es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles en general, ella misma dice que es muy buena con lo que hace, ya que tiene muy buena clientela, y con ello siempre agota todo lo que hace. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio fijo de comestibles en el que podrá vender sus comidas.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer los comestibles que vende, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, panificados y demás. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en: The Kokuere group is in its first cycle of the women's communal bank programme.  They are currently carrying out a survey aimed at eliminating poverty, as this is a way of helping them find out the financial situation of the members.  Soraida, one of the group's members, makes and sells food items and believes that she is successful in what she does because she has a very large clientele and because, with the group's help, she always sells everything she makes.  Her dream is to have a permanent grocery shop where she can sell her food.  She is seeking this loan to buy supplies to make the items of food she sells, namely vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and cakes, amongst other things.  She is very grateful for the chance she has been given.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and cakes, amongst other things.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 38 year old married woman living in Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for more than three years now together with her husband. This is their main source of income. Delia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of their family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Delia hopes to make their business a success and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to Clean and Prune

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 2 months old. She is engaged in the fishing business. She has been in this business for 25 years now. This is the source of her income. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks, floaters, and lead sinkers. These materials will improve her business by helping her to get a better catch. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks, floaters, and lead sinkers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. 

Mary has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to have a large amount of water storage in the near future.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to Clean, Prune and Transplant

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre 27 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE 27 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  el presidente del banco es el Sr. Edgar tiene 48 años, dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la populosa feria 16 de julio,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Edgar va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa chamarras por mayor para esta época de frio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de mercadería,  el Sr. Edgar enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de venta de ropa y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de ropa   y también en la ampliación de su negocio para poder captar más clientes el Sr. Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The business venture bank ALWAYS UNITED 27 is made up of eight members: six women and two men. The president of the bank is Edgar. He is 48 years old and has two children. 

Edgar earns a living selling seasonal clothing from his stall located in a busy market called 16th of July. 

This is his first loan with this institution. Edgar will use the loan to buy coats wholesale for sale during the cold season. He is requesting the loan because he does not have the cash to buy the merchandise. Edgar faces challenges in his business, such as the climatic conditions as well as the competition of the other businesses that sell clothes. He will use his earnings to purchase a variety of clothes and also to expand his business to be able to attract more clients. 

Edgar is a very hard-working individual. He is happy to have the opportunity to have this loan.

loans.use: to buy coats wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clean and set up nursery

loans.name: Mayra Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mayra tiene 43 años y es viuda desde hace 4 años; por lo que ahora tiene la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus dos hijos. Actualmente sus hijos se encuentran estudiando la educación básica y los gastos de la familia se han incrementado. A la vez, los ingreso de su familia se vieron reducidos por el fallecimiento repentino de su esposo debido a un accidente. Mayra se vio en la necesidad  de laborar  y tuvo la idea de establecer en su domicilio un tradicional "bazar", que es un pequeño negocio en su cochera en donde vende todo tipo de articulos usados como juguetes, ropa, zapatos, sillas usadas, articulos para bebes como andadores y "periqueras" (un tipo de sillas para bebé). En los ultimos años, Mayra fue agregando mas variedad de artículos a su negocio;  como perfumes, cremas, vestidos, cosmeticos, bisutería etc. Actualmente y gracias a su constancia y dedicación, Mayra ya cuenta  con una extensa clientela y es conocida por su bazar en su localidad en donde ofrece muy buenos precios y satisface muchas necesidades de sus vecinos. 

Con la idea de seguir creciendo, Mayra tiene en mente adquirir una estructura metálica para poder exhibir su mercancía en los mercados rodantes alrededor de su colonia, es por esos que solicitó el apoyo para adquirir este equipo que sin duda le ayudara a instalarse en los mercados y de esa manera incrementas aun más sus ventas. 

A futuro; y si su negocio va bien en los mercados, Mayra quiere contratar algunos ayudantes para que atiendan su puesto, con lo que le gustaría generar algunos empleos para ayudar a más familias y al mismo tiempo ella poder tener un poco más de tiempo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra is 43 years old. She was widowed four years ago and now is responsible for helping her two children get ahead. Currently her children are in school receiving a basic education and household expenses are increasing. At the same time, family income has fallen due to the sudden death of her husband in an accident. Mayra found it necessary to work and had the idea of opening a traditional second-hand shop in her home. She operates a small business from her car where she sells all kinds of used articles, such as toys, clothing, shoes, used chairs, and items for babies such as walkers and “periqueras,” (a kind of baby chair).  In recent years, Mayra has been adding a greater variety of merchandise to her business, such as perfume, creams, dresses, cosmetics and costume jewelry, etc. Currently, thanks to her dedication and determination, Mayra has an extensive clientele and is known for her second-hand business in her area because she offers good prices and meets the needs of her neighbors. 

With the idea of continuing to grow, Mayra wants to acquire a metallic structure where she can exhibit her merchandise in the markets surrounding her neighborhood. Consequently she requested support in order to acquire this structure that without a doubt will help her to set up a stall in the markets and increase her sales even more.

In the future, and if her business in the markets does well, Mayra wants to hire some assistants to help at her stall. She would like to generate a few jobs to help more families and at the same time be able to have a little more time with her children.

loans.use: to purchase a metallic structure.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is a 27-year-old youth client from Iraq. He is married and a father of 2 children. He works hard to provide for his family by working in his small shop where he manufactures aluminum doors and windows. Karrar has been running his own business since 2007; he gained his experience through previously working at similar shops as an employee for several years. Now, Karrar has his own workplace and his own employee, and has gained the respect of his neighborhood thanks to his competitive prices and professionalism. 

Karrar is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to buy a modern machine used for cutting aluminum. With this loan, Karrar will be able to increase his production which will grow his business and increase his profits. With the increase in his revenues, Karrar will be able to provide all the needed funds to cover his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a modern machine used for cutting aluminum

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan which she used to buy more load cards and cellphone accessories. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her family’s personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan so she can buy extreme load cards and cell phone accessories like batteries, housings and chargers. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cecilia hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more extreme load cards and cell phone accessories like batteries, housings and chargers.

loans.name: Abdulhadi

texts.en: Abdulhadi is a very hard-working person who is always looking to provide a better life for his family. He is 25 years old and a father of three children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He is a bus driver that is focused on earning more money. He hopes in this way to support his children with a better standard of living. Eager to get his business going, he is hoping for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for repairing his bus. As well, he hopes that with his earnings he can provide his family with a better quality of life and a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his bus.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Sarah operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of business. Sarah dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. With her KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan, twenty, is from Iraq. He is single and lives with three other family members; three of them are employed.

Hasan owns a small metal shop where he manufactures water gallons. He established his business in 2010 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has an employee and an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Hasan is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD through CHF to buy specialized equipment for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take better care of his parents and start saving for his future.

loans.use: to buy specialized equipment for his work.

loans.name: Teryline

texts.en:
Teryline is a married woman who has three, school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbours and college students. She faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during holiday seasons when schools have closed. At those times, she experiences a low number of turnouts. With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase supplies for manicures, pedicures, and facials, plus relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair conditioner. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for manicures, pedicures, and facials, plus hair care products

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Baigalmaa is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three sons. They have a ger (traditional, portable, felt dwelling) in Hovd province of western Mongolia. Her husband, Tsogoo, works as a security guard in a local company. He has started an organic vegetable-growing business on their plot of land. Her son, Anhbayar, age 6, just enrolled in primary school, and her twin boys, Byambadorj and Byamba-Ochir, age 2, go to kindergarten. Baigalmaa has been running a clothing sales business, at a rental counter of a local market, since 2009.

She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and soils, to prepare for their cultivation of organic vegetables on their plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soils, to prepare for their cultivation of organic vegetables on their plot of land

loans.name: Bayartogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Bayartogtokh is a married man, who lives with his daughter and wife at Darkhan city. His daughter attends high school, while his wife works in a local water center. 

Bayartogtokh supports his family by operating a transportation business, with a minivan. He runs for local transportation through Darkhan city for most of the year, and during the summer time he contracts with a tourist company and runs for tourists. Before this summer's contract he wants to make some renovation and repair to his minivan. Thus, he is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT  loan, which he will use to change the wheels and the interior section of his minivan, in order to make it more comfortable for tourists.

loans.use: to make some repair work for his minivan before tourist season

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 36 years old and a single woman. She lives at Ugac Sur. She runs a store and sells groceries and other items, for a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years. She usually earns PHP 20,000 each month in her business. She uses her income for meals, bills at home, and revolving capital for use in the business.

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000. She will use it to buy more items to sell in her store, like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo. The purchase of inventory will help increase her sales capacity, and income as well. 

Cecilia hopes to keep improving her small business, to attain financial independence someday. Further, she hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 52-year-old man. He is a father of seven children, living in Taiz, Yemen. He is a bus driver. It has been a profitable business and the only source of income for the family.

He is requesting a loan from AMB, to help him cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts for the bus he drives. This will increase the bus's capacity to work extra hours and will enable him to take additional requests, which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts for the bus he drives.

loans.name: Dyrle

texts.en:
This is Dyrle. She previously took a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages, for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 50,000 PHP. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dyrle dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have her own family someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.
