His monthly income is not enough to cover the household expenses. Therefore, he is interested in purchasing a sewing machine for sewing canvas. This will help him to increase his monthly net income and savings. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for sewing canvas.

loans.name: Marianna

texts.ru: Марианна – из Берегово. Она работает учительницей в школе. Недавно Марианна с семьей смогли приобрести новый дом в селе. Теперь очень хотят создать там нормальные условия для проживания, поштукатурить и побелить стены, установить входные и межкомнатные двери. Для этого Марианна обратилась к КИВА, чтобы получить сумму в 24 000 гривен и улучшить условия проживания для своей семьи благодаря ремонту. Без помощи КИВА Марианне не удастся провести ремонт у себя дома, потому что оба ребенка учатся в университете и Марианна помогает им с оплатой обучения.
texts.en: Marianna is from Berehovo. She is a school teacher. Recently Marianna and her family were able to buy a new home in the village. Now they are very eager to create decent living conditions, plaster and whitewash the walls, install entry doors and inside doors for the rooms. To do this, Marianna has turned to Kiva to get a loan in the amount of 24,000 hriven and improve living conditions for her family through these renovations. Without Kiva's help, Marianna will be unable to fix up her house, for both both of her children are university students and Marianna is paying for their education.

loans.use: plaster and whitewash the walls, install entry doors and inside doors

loans.name: Vinolia

texts.en:
Vinolia is a 58-year-old from Damsoman. She is involved in the sale of cereals (maize, groundnut and millet).

Vinolia travels to the farm to buy this produce and sells it in the local markets.

She has applied for this loan to purchase potatoes, groundnuts, maize and millet. The loan is very important for Vinolia to be able to buy adequate maize, groundnuts, potatoes and millet so that she can sell to customers and make a lot of profit.

Vinolia lives with her three grandchildren, and it is very important for her to earn more income to ensure a better life for her grandchildren.

She needs an amount of 1,000 GHS (Ghanda cedis) to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, groundnuts, maize and millet that she can sell to customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in business for seven years, selling to all categories of people but on a retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.   

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermilinda, de 35 años de edad , vive en compañía de su esposo Mauro y sus 4 hijos a los que educa en la casa de material rústico que compró hace 15 años. Ella posee extensas áreas de terreno agrícola, comenta ser dichosa pues sus sembríos cuentas con riego y su localidad con manantiales que brotan de los cerros. “Por esa razón no tengo pérdidas en mis cosechas, pues tengo riego en cualquier momento y esto hace que crezcan de manera sana”, comenta. Es así que en cada cosecha traslada sus alimentos a la ciudad de Pampas y Huancayo, “todo depende del precio”, afirma con picardía, pues Hermilinda, es muy buena en los negocios, esa razón la llevó a comenzar a producir queso de la leche que producen sus vacas, al día elabora un promedio de 130 moldes pequeños. Ahora se centra en la agricultura, pues comenzará la temporada de cosecha .Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo que recibe de parte de todo ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Hermilinda, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Hermilinda, 35, lives together with her husband Mauro and their four children, raised in a house made with rustic materials that she bought fifteen years ago. Hermilinda owns a large piece of land suitable for agriculture and she says that she feels satisfied because her plantations have an irrigation system and the locality has water springs that flow down from the mountains. “This is why my harvests do not give me any loss; I can irrigate them at any time, which makes them grow healthy,” she says.

She takes her produce to the cities of Pampas and Huancayo, “depending on the price,” she says with certain spark in her eyes. Hermilinda is a good businesswoman, which is why she started producing cheese from the milk produced by her cows. On average, she produces 130 small molds every day.

Hermilinda is now focused on her agricultural activities, since the sowing season is approaching. This is her first loan with Kiva and she appreciates the support she receives from all of you. She also promises to pay the installments on time. Hermilinda will use the 1,500 soles [PEN] to buy compost for her plantations.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Él presta sus servicios en la fuerza armada naval del país, y en su tiempo libre cultiva maíz trabajo que realiza desde los 12 años de edad; aprendió de su padre. Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a dos kilómetros y medio de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de maíz y fríjol, y lo desea hacer de manera anticipada porque no tiene mucho tiempo libre debido a su trabajo. Con lo que gana en su empleo solo le ajusta para algunos gastos del hogar y no puede comprar los insumos agrícolas. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
José, age 31, is married and has four children.  He lends his services to the naval armed forces of the country.  In his free time he grows corn.  He has been doing this work since he was 12 years old, and he learned from his father.  He gets the agricultural supplies in a city that is two and a half kilometers from his house.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy agricultural supplies for his corn and bean crops.  He wishes to do so ahead of time because he does not have much free time due to his work.

With what he earns from his job he can only pay for some household expenses.  He is not able to buy the agricultural supplies.

His wish is to improve his house and for his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother of four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her cousins. She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 20 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, maize flour and small jerrycans of cooking oil. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building her own house. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, maize flour and small jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна уже обращалась к КИВА за финансовой поддержкой. За счет своевременно полученной финансовой помощи она смогла быстро и выгодно реализовать свой товар и получить больше прибыли. 
В этот раз Татьяна планирует увеличить количество и ассортимент товара для реализации на своей точке.
texts.en: Tatyana   already applied Kiva for financial support before. Thanks to timely financing, she was able to sell her merchandise quickly and at a good profit,   increasing her revenues. This time Tatyana plans to increase the volume and variety of her merchandise to be sold at her sales stand.

loans.use: to increase the volume and variety of her merchandise to be sold at her sales stand.

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Madame Ramatou est une célibataire de 23 ans et mère de 1 enfant. Elle vit avec son enfant chez son père dans le quartier Faraba de Bougouni. 
Après les études secondaires où elle obtient son diplôme en secrétariat de Direction, elle est restée très longtemps sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’elle décide de suivre sa mère pour apprendre les activités de préparation et vente de jus. Avec 3 ans d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité. 
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers une autre cliente Ramatou décida d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 15 kilos de sucre, 5 kilos de dah, 2 kilos de gingembre, des paquets de sachets plastiques et d’arômes. Les jus sont vendus dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni. 
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ramatou is single, 23 years old, and a mother of one child. She lives with her child at her father's house in the Faraba neighborhood of Bougouni. After secondary school, where she received a diploma to be an administrative assistant, she was unemployed for a long time. Thus, she decided to follow in the footsteps of her mother and learn how to make and sell juice.

She conducts this business now with three years of experience. Having heard about Soro Yiriwaso through a customer, Ramatou decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. She is now on her second loan, after having correctly repaid her first.

With his loan, she plans to buy 15 kilograms of sugar, 5 kilograms of bissap, 2 kilograms of ginger, some packets of plastic bags, and some flavorings. 

The juice is sold in different parts of Bougouni. 

Ramatou hopes to earn, with this loan, an average monthly income of 25,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to meet her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make juice

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been selling foodstuffs in the town of Dansoman. She sells cassava, plantains and other vegetables. She is 59 years old and married with two adult children. The children are working and taking care of themselves.

This will be her forth loan from ID-Ghana. Esther plans to use the loan to buy more cassava, plantains and vegetables to sell. This will enable her to increase her inventory. Currently, she only sells vegetables three days a the week because she does not have enough capital to buy vegetables to sell throughout the week.  

Esther will use this GHS 500 to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, plantains and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is married with five children, and of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  

Berna has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and bread to sell. She works from a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to see her children attain an education at the university level. 

Berna resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include her children's school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and bread to sell.

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Fallah is an Iraqi youth client who is 23 years old, single and lives with his family consisting of eight members, four of whom are employed.

Fallah owns a small shop where he repairs motorcycles. He established his business in 2009 and gained much experience in this field. Now, Fallah has an employee hired and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Fallah is requesting a youth loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to rent the next-door shop and expand his business. With this loan, Fallah aims to increase his profits, and he will be able to start saving money for his future plans.

loans.use: to rent the next-door shop and expand his business.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке в селе Водяное. Сельским хозяйством стал заниматься еще 10 лет назад. Живет с женой и дочерью в своем доме. Доход с огорода – стабильный. Сергей выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис. Он очень трудолюбивый, хозяйство большое, наблюдается постоянное развитие. 
Сергей обратился к КИВА за финансовой помощью в размере 22 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить удобрения и заплатить наемным работникам за работу в сезон. В будущем Сергей хотел бы также переделать отопление: поменять котлы и установить более мощные. Сергей не отчаивается. 2008 год выдался неурожайным, подвела погода, и он практически ничего не заработал. Пришлось больше работать, меньше тратить и получилось наверстать на следующий год.
texts.en:
Sergei grows vegetables on his land plot in the village of Vodyanoye. He has started farming 10 years ago. He lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. The income from his vegetable garden is stable. Sergei grows tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes. He is very hard-working: his farm is big and keeps growing.

Sergei turned to Kiva for financial support in the amount of UAH in order to buy fertilizers and pay seasonal workers. In the future Sergei would like to replace the heating system, replacing the boilers by more powerful ones. Sergei does not lose hope. In 2008, his harvest was low due to weather conditions, and he earned next to nothing. He had to work more and spend less, and managed to make up for the losses the following year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay seasonal workers.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a divorced mother of two children, who are still too young to go to school. She lives in her home, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Maurine operates a food-market business, selling to villages and students from the nearby school. In addition, she also has a tailoring business, which enables her to earn another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operations. She dreams of establishing a shop in which she can sell her products in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 loan that she is requesting, Maurine wants to boost her tailoring business by purchasing fabrics and sewing threads. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing threads.

loans.name: Soom Be Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme T.CELINE représente le groupe SOM BE WENDE.  Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont  à l’école.
Mme est restauratrice  depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de toecin. Ses clients sont les  hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 cartons de poisson et 05 sachets d’atiéké (couscous de manioc).
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désire épargner. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
T. Celine represents the Soom Be Wende group. Married, she is a mother of five children. The oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Two of her children go to school.

T. Celine has been running a restaurant for eight years. She procures her goods from a market in Toecin. Her customers are men and women. [With this loan], she wants to buy two cartons of fish and five packets of atiéké (cassava couscous). 

With her earnings, she wants to save [up money]. T. Celine dreams of expanding her business and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish and five packets of atiéké (cassava couscous)

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, es un humilde zapatero de 40 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada, padre de tres hijos de los cuales uno de ellos no estudia pues es discapacitado. 
Su experiencia en el negocio del calzado la adquirió desde muy joven cuando trabajo como ayudante  en un taller de zapatería después viajo a Costa Rica ahí trabajo también en la elaboración de zapatos de cueros el ahorro dinero y cuando regreso a Nicaragua logro comprar su primeras máquinas para comenzar elaborar zapatos. Actualmente tiene 6 años de trabajar con su taller donde produce calzado con cuero nacional  su especialidad es el calzado para caballeros pues es muy solicitado debido a la calidad del producto. El sale a vender a las ciudades de Chinandega, León y Granada. 
Él requiere el crédito para comprar cuero, suelas, pegamento, clavos. El financiamiento le permitirá comprar con más facilidad la materia prima que necesita para trabajar. Su deseo es llegar a tener un taller más grande con más ayudantes y especializarse con la exportación del calzado nacional.
texts.en:
José, 40, is a modest cobbler from the city of Granada.  He's the father of three children, one of whom is disabled and doesn't attend school.

He acquired his experience in footwear at a young age when he worked as an assistant in a cobbler shop after he traveled to Costa Rica, where he also worked making leather shoes.  He saved money and when he returned to Nicaragua managed to buy his first machines to start making shoes.

Currently he has six years of experience in his shop, where he produces shoes from Nicaraguan leather.  His specialty is men's shoes, which are in high demand because of the quality of the product.  He sells in the cities of Chinandega, León, and Granada.

He needs a loan to buy leather, soles, glue, and nails so he can more easily buy the raw materials he needs to work.

His desire is to have a bigger workshop with more assistants and specialize in exporting Nicaraguan shoes.

loans.use: to buy leather, soles, glue, and nails

loans.name: Mindia

texts.en:
Mindia is 38 years old. He lives in the village of Akhalisopeli with his 62-year-old father and 40-year-old brother. 

Mindia has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times in order to start a family business. However, he has not had success. His loan requests were all rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has an agricultural plot of land where nut trees and maize are grown. They also have milk cows, which are milked to make dairy products. By selling the harvested nuts, maize and dairy products locally at the markets, the family earns a small monthly income. However, this is rarely enough to cover their living expenses. 

Mindia has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received loan, Mindia plans to open a cement workshop in which he can make cement blocks. He will purchase all the needed materials such as cement and start making blocks, which will be sold among the resellers. He will use the profits for reinvesting, in order to improve the business and increase its profitability. The new business will give Mindia a chance to grow the family's income and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cement and other materials so he can start making cement blocks for his new start-up business.

loans.name: Mbathie's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois créé le 22 décembre 2009 est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le commerce. Une bonne entente et solidarité règnent entre elles.
Coura debout à droite de la photo, est membre du Banc Villageois depuis l'ouverture.Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont une fille.
Elle fait comme activité de l’embouche ovine. Elle compte acheter 5 moutons à 45000francs CFA .Pour engraisser les moutons elle va  acheter des vitamines à 2500francs, de l’aliment de bétail à savoir: du pain sec 3  sacs à 9000francs ,  du foin à 25000francs  et divers autres produits qui vont permettre de bien nourrir les animaux.
A noter qu'elle peut compter sur l'aide de ses parents pour la vente.
Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes et assister son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was established December 22, 2009 and is composed of women who live in the same village. They engage in commerce as their principal activity. They have good understanding and [a sense of] solidarity between them. 

Coura, standing on the right of the photo, has been a member of the banc villages since its opening. She is 38 years old. She is married and a mother of five children, of whom one is a girl. 

Coura raises and fattens sheep for a living. She hopes to buy 5 sheep for 45,000 francs CFA. To fatten the sheep, she is going to buy vitamins for 2,500 francs and animal feed [consisting of]: 3 sacs of dried bread for 9,000 francs, hay for 25,000 francs, and various other products, which are going to allow [her] to feed the animals well. 

To note, she can count on her parents to help with sales. 

The income earned will allow her to increase her savings and help her husband take care of their family's needs.

loans.use: to buy five sheep to fatten

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Dansoman and earns a living by selling cloth at the market, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Theresa is requesting a loan from ID Ghana for 1,500 GHS, which she will use to buy additional cloth to sell to customers. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 27 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers, and pay labor costs to improve his maize harvest. With the profits from the farming, he will build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a debt that he has with another institution. He will use the remaining funds to purchase more merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edith tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la prestación de servicio desde hace 12 años donde su trabajo es lavar y planchar ropa para obtener ingresos para sacar a su familia adelante; ya que es una persona que se preocupa por que su familia este bien y no le haga falta las cosas y tener lo necesario para el consumo de su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 metros de arena, 10 bolsas de cemento, 4 tablas de 3 metros, 2 cuartones de 3 metros, 2 cuartones de 2 metros, 3 cuartones de 1 metros para mejorar  el piso de la casa ya que es de tierra y la señora quiere ponerle un plafon de cemento y ademas la madera que comprara es para hacer una puerta y colocarla en una habitación que no tiene y poder tener mas segura su casa.

ella podrá mejorar su condición de vida teniendo una vivienda en optimas condiciones y mas segura tanto para ella como para su familia ya que se preocupa por darle a su familia una vivienda en condiciones favorables para vivir.

Ella comenta que quiere seguir trabajando para mejor poco a poco las condiciones de vida y darle a sus hijos lo necesario y vivan en las condiciones adecuadas que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Edith is 45 years old, single, and has two children.  She has worked for 12 years washing and ironing clothing to earn income to move her family forward.  She is a person who cares that her family is well and are not lacking for things and have everything they need.

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase 2 meters of sand, 10 bags of cement, 4 3-meter planks, 2 3-meter planks, 2 2-meter planks, and 3 1-meter planks to improve the floor of her home.  Currently she has a dirt floor and she wants to install a concrete floor.  The wood she will purchase is to make a door and put it in a room that doesn't have one so that she can make her house more secure. 

She can improve her quality of life by having a home in optimal condition and more secure both for herself and for her family since she cares about giving her family a good place to live.

She commented that she wants to continue working to improve her quality of life little by little and give her children what they need.  She wants them to live in adequate conditions since she did not have them.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and wood planks to make her home more secure.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 28 years old. He lives in Batumi District with his 21-year-old wife, 56-year-old mother and an infant child (1 year old). Irakli requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but he did not have any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is Irakli’s monthly salary. He works in a sugar company as a distributor. The amount of salary is really small and it’s rarely enough to feed the family. 

Irakli requested a loan from Credo to start up family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Irakli will purchase grocery stocks to open a grocery store. He will work in the shop himself so there won’t be extra expenses to pay for an employee. This will significantly increase the profit. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting and developing the shop. Irakli will be purchasing more stocks of groceries to offer a wide variety of products to his clients. The new business will bring a good income to Irakli and his family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stocks to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 27 years old. He is single and has been a maize farmer for 9 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs to maximize his maize harvests. With the profits from the farming, he will build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 53 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 33 years. 

She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer, and pay labor costs for getting enough maize returns. The profits from the farming will be used to pay for the school fees for the children -- eight children are enrolled in schools.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor tiene 31 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años ella se dedica a la crianza y reproducción de ganado y su esposo hoy en día a iniciado su negocio de carpintería. Los materiales los compra en una ciudad que esta a veinticinco kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera; debido a que junto con su esposo están iniciando el negocio de la carpintería. De esta manera tendrá disponible madera para fabricar los muebles en el momento que lo soliciten sus clientes. Con el nuevo negocio podrán ingresar a mejores ganancias para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su sueño es que su carpintería sea la mejor de la zona y distribuir muebles a las comerciales.
texts.en:
Flor is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  She has worked raising and breeding livestock for ten years, and her husband has recently started a carpentry business.  They purchase the materials in a city about 25 kilometers from their house.

Flor is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase wood since she is starting a carpentry business with her husband.  This will allow them to have wood available to make furniture at the time it is ordered by their customers.  This new business will allow them to earn more income to support their family.

Her dream is that the carpentry business becomes the best in the area and distributes furniture to stores.

tiene 31 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años ella se dedica a la crianza y reproducción de ganado y su esposo hoy en día a iniciado su negocio de carpintería. Los materiales los compra en una ciudad que esta a veinticinco kilómetros de su casa.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Jorge Juan

texts.es:
Jorge de 33 años, es un emprendedor. Laboró por más de ocho años en una fábrica de tapetes en donde aprendió y adquirió experiencia en la actividad. Desde hace un año decidió retirarse y crear su propia empresa aprovechando los conocimientos adquiridos. Labora desde su vivienda y a que las gestiones de mercadeo por teléfono y redes sociales con el fin de ahorrar costos. 
Labora diariamente de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde. 
Como su negocio está en la etapa de introducción, Jorge se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos para la fabricación de un mayor número de tapetes que le han solicitado  sus clientes.  Su mayor deseo es crecer dentro de este mercado y alcanzar su punto de maduración, lo que le permitirá garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 33 year old entrepreneur.  He worked for more than eight years in a mat factory where he learned and aquired experience.  About a year ago, he decided to leave and start his own business, taking advantage of the knowledge he obtained.  He works from his home and does marketing by telephone and on social networks to save costs.  He works every day from 7:00am until 6:00pm.

Since his business is in the starting phase, Jorge is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make a larger number of mats that his customers have ordered.  His biggest hope is to grow in this market and reach a point of maturity that will allow him to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make mats.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 39 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 15 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and to pay labor costs for getting enough maize returns. The profits from the farming will be used to buy more cattle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Epaphrodit

texts.en:
Epaphrodit is 35 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 15 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and to pay labor costs for getting enough maize returns. The profits from the farming will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en:
Theodosie is 36 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 18 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and to pay labor costs for getting enough maize returns. The profits from the farming will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: José Libardo

texts.es:
Libardo de 48 años de edad, ha trabajado toda su vida en el campo, se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos. Se ha caracterizado por querer brindarle un bienestar a su familia, y mejores condiciones de vida. Razón por la cual  se dedica al cultivo y venta de aromáticas, al mismo tiempo que alterna esta actividad con la cría y engorde de pollos que posteriormente son vendidos en su municipio.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de semillas y adecuaciones del galpón con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción y mejorar sus ventas. 
Su sueño es mejorar su fuente de ingresos, brindándoles a sus dos hijos una educación de calidad y apartados de toda carencia económica.
texts.en:
Libardo is 48 years old and has worked as a farmer all his life.  He is married and has two children.  He wants to provide a good environment for his family and give them better living conditions.  In order to do that, he works cultivating and selling herbs, as well as raising and fattening chickens to sell in town.

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and make improvements to a chicken coop so that he can increase his production and improve his sales.

His dream is to improve his source of income, provide his two children with a quality education, and be financially secure.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and make improvements to a chicken coop.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene seis hijos; pero solo dos viven con ella. Desde hace 5 años administra una empresa de su hermanos; antes solo se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos y trabajos agrícolas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arena, piedra, bloque, cemento y pago de mano de obra para construir una habitación en su casa. Con la construcción, vivirán más cómodos; ya que actualmente están algo estrechos en la casa y no pueden descansar muy bien. Su próximo, objetivo es construir un muro perimetral al contorno del terreno para dar seguridad.
texts.en:
María is fifty years old and is in a relationship. She has six children, but only two live with her. She has been running a company that her siblings own for five years. Before, she raised chickens and worked in agriculture.

María is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy sand, gravel, bricks and cement and to pay for the labor needed to build a room in her house. With the room, her family will be more comfortable; they feel a bit tight now and cannot rest as they should. Her next goal is to build a wall around her property to make it safer.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, bricks and cement and to pay for labor to build a room.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 53 years old. He is married, with nine children, to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 22 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and to pay labor costs for getting enough maize returns. The profits from the farming will be used to renovate his house.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 40 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 17 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and to pay labor costs for getting enough maize returns. The profits from the farming will be used to reinvest in the maize farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is a married Iraqi youth client, who is 29 years old and has two children. 

Karrar provides his family income by working hard in his shop, where he sells mobile phones and their accessories. He not only sells, but also repairs mobile phones. He gained his experience in phone reparation through taking several courses in this field. After gaining all the needed experience, Karrar established his own business in 2011. He gained good fame in the area, thanks to the good services he offers.

Karrar is requesting a youth loan of USD 2,400 to pay the annual rent of his shop and to install a display window. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to install a display window.

loans.name: Bronislava

texts.ru:
Бронислава – из Новой Каховки. Она занимается торговлей мужской одеждой на одном из крупных местных рынков. В этом бизнесе она занята уже 19 лет. Бронислава арендует торговый ларек у администрации рынка. 
Брониславе понадобилась сумма в 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы выгодно закупить рубашки, майки и футболки под реализацию в сезон. Имея достаточный опыт торговли, ходовой товар и постоянных клиентов, она надеется и дальше успешно заниматься этим бизнесом, постепенно увеличивая свой доход.
texts.en:
Bronislava is from Novaya Kahovka. She sells men’s clothing at one of the local markets. She has been in this business for 19 years already. Bronislava rents a sales stand from the market’s administration.

Bronislava needs 21,000 UAH in order to  stock up on shirts, sleeveless shirts and T-shirts at a good price in order to sell them in season.  Thanks to her ample experience in the business, attractive merchandise and a loyal customer base, she hopes to continue being successful in this business, gradually increasing her income.

loans.use: to  stock up on shirts, sleeveless shirts and T-shirts  in order to sell them in season.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is married and has three children who attend school. For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business. She also sells charcoal to local neighbors. 

Dorothy is requesting a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she willl use to purchase more dry fish and charcoal to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Dorothy faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eavariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 33 years old. He and his wife have been maize farmers for the last eight years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and pay the cost of hiring people to help him with his crop. With the profits from farming, he plans to buy more land so that he can expand his maize plantation

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs for maize production.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is single and operates a retail charcoal business, selling to local customers. 

Jennifer is requesting a loan from Yehu for 15,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bags of charcoal to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Jenifer faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 37 years old and married to a farmer. They have been farming maize for 15 years. Jean is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs for maize production. Jean will use the profits from the farming to build a house for his residences.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es: Pedro, de 44 años de edad, casado padre de 3 hijos de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta y reparación de baterías en la ciudad de Granada. El inicio este negocio hace 10 años cuando el trabajaba para un señor que armaba y vendía motores de autos él fue adquiriendo experiencia hasta que decidió poner su propio negocio. Fue comprando poco a poco los equipos necesarios hasta lograr independizarse. Actualmente vende baterías que el mismo repara al igual que baterías nuevas selladas. Él está requiriendo el crédito para comprar más baterías de carro para vender . Su idea es ir agregando más producto tales como repuestos para motos, carros, aceites, lubricantes, llantas pues su idea es ofrecer más variedad de productos y captar más clientela para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro, 44, is married and the father of three children.  A retailer by trade, he sells and repairs batteries in the city of Granada.

He started this business 10 years ago when he was working for a man who built and sold automobile engines.  He acquired experience until he decided to set up his own business.  Little by little he bought the necessary equipment until he managed to go out on his own.  Currently he sells batteries that he himself has repaired as well as new sealed batteries.

He needs the loan to buy more car batteries to sell.

His idea is to add more products such as motorcycle and car parts, oil, lubricants, and tires to offer a greater variety and attract more customers to make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy car batteries

loans.name: Dialang's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 13 décembre 2003, le Banc Villageois regroupe en son sein des femmes qui partagent l’idéal que toute personne doit être utile à la société et particulièrement à sa famille. Ce groupe est porté actuellement à 35 femmes qui sont animées d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce.

Madame Dialang (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de trois filles et d’un garçon. Elle a adhéré à ce groupe car les femmes y sont travailleuses.
Elle vend des condiments et divers produits alimentaires dans le marché de la commune et elle effectue au besoin des déplacements dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la zone.  

 Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte renforcer sa capacité de financer son activité par l’achat en quantité de bouillons et autres assaisonnements.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’accroître son niveau d’épargne pour bénéficier de prêts plus important dans le futur.
texts.en:
Created on December 13, 2003, this Banc Villageois is composed of women who share the ideal that everyone must be useful to society and to one's family in particular. This group currently comprises 35 women motivated by solidarity and mutual aid. They all live in the same town and have small-scale businesses.

Ms. Dialang (sitting at the far right with her right hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three girls and a boy. She joined this group because the women in it are hard-working. She sells condiments and a variety of grocery items at the commune's market, and she makes trips as needed to weekly markets in the area. 

With her new loan, she intends to bolster her business' financial capacity by purchasing large amounts of bouillon cubes and other seasonings. 

The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and to increase her level of savings, so as to benefit from larger loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of bouillon cubes and other seasonings

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es:
Liliana de 25 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, llena de sueños y retos por cumplir. Su familia es su mayor aliciente y la fuerza que la motiva a luchar por un mejor porvenir. Tiene un hijo de un año de edad, por el que trabaja incansablemente a fin de brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida. En la actualidad cuenta con un taller de marroquinería en su residencia, actividad que aprendió gracias  a la oportunidad que tuvo de trabajar en un taller de calzado. 
Desde hace dos años esta actividad se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para la compra de una máquina troqueladora industrial con el fin de mejorar su proceso de producción y disminuir costos.
Espera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local.
texts.en:
Liliana is 25 years old.  She is an enterprising woman full of dreams and challenges to meet.  Her family is her greatest incentive and the force that motivates her to fight for a better future.  She has a one year old son and she works tirelessly to give him better opportunities in life.  Currently she has a leather workshop in her home, an activity that she learned thanks to the opportunity she had to work in a shoe workshop.

Two years ago, this work became the only source of income to support her household.  Now she is requesting a loan to purchase an industrial die-cut machine in order to improve her production process and decrease costs.  

She hopes that this will improve her quality of life and allow her to continue growing in the local market.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial die-cut machine.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, siempre ha laborado en diferentes sectores de la economía, debido a que considera que lo más importante es garantizarle a sus tres hijos mejores condiciones de vida. 
Hace ocho años comenzó a laborar como administradora de una tienda de bolsos en su localidad, pero posteriormente decidió retirarse y crear su propio negocio a fin de mejorar su condición económica y la calidad de vida de su familia.
Hoy lleva cinco años con su tienda y asegura que ha sido la mejor decisión ya que su trabajo le permite compartir más tiempo en familia.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos, con los que espera poder garantizarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old.  She has always worked in different sectors of the economy since she considers giving her three children better living conditions the most important thing. 

Eight years ago, she started to work as the administrator of a store selling bags in her community, but she later decided to resign and start her own business in order to improve her financial situation and her family's quality of life.  Now she has had her business for five years and she said it has been the best decision because it allows her to spend more time with her family.

Currently she is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise in order to increase her sales and improve her income, which she hopes will give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase backpacks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Ghana. She is single and is a slippers seller. She has been selling this product for eight years. She works from 8:00 AM until 5:00 PM. She is a client of one of the branches of the ID-Ghana and has already repaid three previous loans.

Mary is requesting a new loan of GHS 1,000  to purchase slippers for resale. This loan will help her to increase her sales volume and to better meet the demand from her customers.

With increased earnings, Mary will be able to improve her business and save more money. In the future, she would like to open shoe and clothing stores.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Leonel Enrique

texts.es:
Leonel, es un joven d 27 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada, padre de tres hijos, él  es de oficio comerciante es dueño de una pulpería y alquiler de nintendo. Su esposa lo apoya ayudándolo con la pulpería mientras él hace las compras para surtir el negocio. Además de eso él tiene el negocio de alquiler nintendo como otras formas de ingresos para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus hijos. Él tiene un sueño de lograr brindarles un techo digno a sus hijos es uno de sus proyectos, lleva tres de tener la pulpería y hace 1 año que inicio con el alquiler de nintendo el cual le genera buenos ingresos . 
Él está solicitando el crédito para comprar 2 televisores, granos básicos, aceite, gaseosas, enlatados, avenas, papel higiénico, productos de limpieza. Todos productos de consumo diario y constante de los cuales su clientela necesita. Él quiere poco a poco llegar convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea y mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Leonel, 27, is a native of the city of Granada.  He's the father of three children.  A retailer by trade, he owns a general store and rents video games.  His wife helps him with the store and he makes the purchases to stock the business.  He also has a business renting video games as well as other forms of income to help with the household expenses and his children's school.

His dream is to give his children a good house; this is one of his projects.  He has had the store for three years.  A year ago he started the rental business, which generates a good income for him.

He's requesting the loan to buy two television sets, basic staples, oil, soda, canned goods, oatmeal, toilet paper, and cleaning products, all daily consumer products that his customers constantly need. 

Little by little he wants to convert his store into a convenience store and improve conditions for his business and his family.

loans.use: to buy daily consumer products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 8 quintals of corn and 10 gas cylinders. All of the materials that she will buy will be used in the production of tortillas for a month. To make pupusas on weekends she will buy 4 pounds of pork rinds and 4 pounds of soft cheese. She will also use the new loan to make the payments on her current loan.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hard-working woman who is investing well in business. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She is running a business of selling chicken to her customers, to satisfy their needs and also to improve her lifestyle. She is requesting for a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy medicine for her chickens and also to feed them.

loans.use: to buy medicine and feed for her chickens

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Ces femmes ont intégré le Banc villageois dés sa création  le 13 décembre 2003. 
Elles sont très rigoureuses et déterminées dans leurs activités respectives et ont connues des évolutions très significatives. 
Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la restauration.
Debout au milieu, madame Diènaba est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 39 ans, est mariée, mère de 4 enfants (1 garçon et 3 filles). 
Elle vend des articles vestimentaires : sac, chaussures, tissus qu’elle achète en gros pour la revente en détail.
Actuellement elle a ouvert un restaurant dans lequel elle sert le petit déjeuner et le déjeuner.
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’approvisionner son restaurant par l’achat de sac de riz, de bidon d’huile et divers autres produits entrant dans la préparation des plats qu’elle sert. 
Avec les bénéfices, comme durant les cycles précédents  elle compte poursuivre l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et le maintien de ses enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
These women joined the Banc Villageois as soon as it was created on December 13, 2003. They are very strict and determined in their respective businesses, and they have experienced very significant growth. Their main work involves small-scale businesses and restaurants. 

Standing in the middle in the photo, Ms. Diènaba is the featured borrower. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four children (1 boy and 3 girls). She sells articles of clothing: handbags, shoes, and fabrics that she purchase wholesale and then sells retail. Right now, she has opened a restaurant in which she serves breakfasts and lunch. 

This new loan will enable her to supply her restaurant by purchasing sacks of rice, containers of oil, and various other products that go into making the dishes she serves.

With the profits, as in previous cycles, she plans to pursue improvements in her family's living conditions and keeping her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and various other products for making the food she serves

loans.name: María Aceneth

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, los cuales sacó sola adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación, debido a que su cónyuge la abandonó sin asumir ninguna responsabilidad.
Por su condición de madre soltera y las labores que debe realizar como ama de casa, se dedicó a la venta de ropa desde su hogar. Posteriormente con el incremento de clientes y la acogida de sus productos alquiló un local. Hoy lleva más de 10 años en el mercado lo que le brinda mucha seguridad y satisfacción.

Su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar y garantizarles a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
50-year-old María is a single mother with four children.  She has put her heart and soul into bringing up her children on her own as her husband left her without fulfilling any of his responsibilities.  

As a single mother who also had housework to take care of, María started out selling clothing from home.  Later, as her number of customers increased and her products became popular, she rented a sales location.  She has been in the market for more than 10 years now and this gives her a lot of security and satisfaction.

María's biggest wish is to continue growing her business.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying merchandise which will allow her to increase her sales and make more income so that she can improve her family's living conditions and guarantee her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: María Yohana

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, por los cuales lucha incansablemente para ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida. Actualmente se dedica a la confección, actividad que aprendió debido a que laboró como operaria de confección en diferentes empresas. Después de años de trabajo como empleada decidió crear su propio taller con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos y las condiciones económicas de su hogar.

Hoy María es una mujer bastante reconocida en el sector por la calidad de su trabajo y el buen servicio. Su mayor sueño es crear su propia línea de ropa, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas, con las que iniciará su nuevo proyecto. 
Espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir creciendo en el sector.
texts.en:
49-year-old María is a single mother with three children for whom she works tirelessly so that she can provide them with better living conditions.  She currently works as a seamstress, a trade that she learned while working as a sewing machine operator for different companies.  After years of working as an employee, she decided to set up her own workshop so that she could improve her family's financial situation.

María is now well known in her field for the good quality of her work and the good service she provides.  Her biggest dream is to create her own line of clothing.  She is requesting this loan to buy fabric which she will use to start her new project.

María hopes to be able to improve her family's quality of life and continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Thaciana

texts.en:
Thaciana is 39 years old. She and her husband have been maize farmers for seven years. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer, and to hire workers to help with her crop. She will use her profits from farming to renovate her home. In the picture, we see behind her the place where loan recipients gather for their meeting as a cooperative.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and hire workers to help with maize production.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 54 years old. He and his wife are farmers and have been growing maize for the last 20 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and to hire workers to help harvest his crop. He will use the profit he earns from farming to buy more land. Behind him in the photo we see some of the other people who are members of his farming cooperative. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and hire workers to help with his crop.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha de 38 años  de edad, se ha caracterizado por se una mujer innovadora y creativa, llena de carisma y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, luchando por un mejor futuro para sus dos hijos menores de edad. Debido a los bajos ingresos de su esposo, Martha decidió trabajar y colaborar con las obligaciones y la educación de sus hijos. 
Comenzó vendiendo helados desde su casa, y  hoy ya cuenta con un pequeño local debido a la alta demanda de sus productos 
En la actualidad desea comprar un refrigerador y realizar algunas mejoras locativas a su negocio con el fin de aumentar sus ventas, y atraer un mayor número de clientes. 
 Su gran sueño es brindarles a sus dos hijos la oportunidad de acceder en un futuro próximo a la educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Martha, 38, stands out for being a very innovative, creative woman who is very charismatic and who very much wants to get ahead striving for a better future for her minor children.  Because of her husband’s low income earning, Martha decided to work and help cover expenses and her children’s schooling costs.

She started out selling ice-cream at home and today has a small shop thanks to the high demand her products have.  She currently wants to buy a refrigerator and to make some site improvements to the shop aiming at increasing sales and attracting a larger number of customers.  Her great dream is to provide her children with the opportunity of having access to a university career in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to make site improvements

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en:
Marie Therese is 35 years old. She is married to a farmer, and they have been farming maize for 20 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers, and to pay labor costs, for getting enough maize yield. The profits from the farming will be used to expand their maize farm.

Behind in the picture, other cooperative members are looking for her.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es:
Luis de 44 años de edad, siempre soñó con crear su propio negocio, tener una estabilidad económica que le permitiera ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Razón que lo motivó a iniciar su negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar.
Gracias a su negocio, ha podido brindarles a sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad una buena educación y un mejor porvenir. 
Hoy, Luis se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permita satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y cumplir su gran sueño de tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis, 44, always dreamed of creating his own business, of having financial stability so he could give his family a better quality of life.  This motivated him to start his own business selling products from the family shopping basket. 

Thanks to his business he has been able to give his two children, ages 16 and 10, a good education and a better future.

Now Luis is looking for a loan to buy supplies so he can satisfy his customers' needs and increase his sales.  This will allow him to generate more income and achieve his big dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy basic staples

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an Iraqi youth client, who is 24 years old. He lives with his parents, and he is the only provider for his family. He owns a small shop, where he sells women's clothes. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Ali gained a good reputation in his surrounding area, thanks to his competitive prices.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of $2,400. He will use the loan to renovate his shop, by installing a display window. He is aiming to grow his business more, so that he may be able to take better care of his parents.

loans.use: to renovate his shop, by installing a display window

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya is 51 years old and a widow who has three children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, spices, soft drinks, soap and sugar. Ligaya has been in this business for 5 years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and married. She has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business, selling dried fish, in the Philippines. She has been running the dried fish business for eight years, and she earns additional income by selling charcoal.

Violeta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en:
Sarah Jean is 34 years old and married. She has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years, and she earns additional income by selling charcoal.

Sarah Jean is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough to provide a secure for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nudier Giselly

texts.es:
Nudier de 38 años de edad, es una mujer visionaria y con muchos deseos de convertirse en microempresaria. Por su condición de madre soltera, esta mujer ha luchado constantemente para brindarles a sus hijos educación y condiciones de vida digna. Con esfuerzo y dedicación logró montar su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de papelería y fotocopias, actividad que le genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Sueña con tener en un futuro próximo la capacidad de comprar el local en donde tiene su negocio con el fin de ahorrarse el dinero del arrendamiento.
Por ahora desea acceder a un crédito para la compra de surtido con el fin de mejorar las ventas y aumentar sus ingresos. 
Sus hijas se encuentran próximas a iniciar sus estudios universitarios por lo cual espera obtener un mayor margen de rentabilidad para pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nudier, 38, is a forward-looking woman who very much wants to become a micro businesswoman.  Because she’s a single mother, she’s constantly striving to provide her children with education and proper living conditions.  With effort and dedication she managed to open her own business selling stationery supplies and photocopies, an activity that generates income to support her family.

She dreams in the near future with having the capacity of buying the site her business is located in order to save on rental costs.  For now, she needs a loan to buy stock merchandise to improve sales and increase income.  Her daughters are about to start university so she hopes to increase her profit margin so she can pay for their studies.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines, and supplements the income she earns there by selling food. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy more items to sell to her customers, including canned goods, bread, eggs, spices, coffee, milk and soap. Rosemarie has sustained her business with four prior loans from NWTF and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson de 41 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora que siempre ha buscado alternativas para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Debido a la escasez de trabajo optó por montar una tienda dedicada a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar y generar los ingresos para su hogar. 
En búsqueda de expandir su negocio y posicionarlo es su municipio, Wilson se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido, para ampliar su portafolio de productos y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.  Espera que con dicha inversión pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y contribuir al desarrollo de su actividad comercial, la cual es su única fuente de sostenimiento.
texts.en:
41-year-old Wilson is a hard-working person who has always looked for ways to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Owing to a lack of work opportunities, Wilson decided to set up his own store selling basic household products in order to make income for his household.  He is requesting a loan to invest in buying stock, to expand his range of products and to provide his customers with a better service so that he can grow his business and better position it within the town.  He hopes that this investment will enable him to improve his family's quality of life and contribute to the development of his business which is his sole source of support.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is aged 48. He is married to a farmer, and they have been farming maize for 20 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers, and to pay labor costs, for getting enough maize yield. The profits from the farming will be used to buy more land for use in farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and pay for support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es soltera y tiene un hijo un varón que está en etapa escolar, vive en un departamento donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, baño, la  habitación es de ladrillo y el piso es de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona El Rosario de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja de empleada en una institución privada, se dedica a la atención al público en general y por las tardes trabaja vendiendo sus productos cosméticos de la línea de Esika y Yanval;  trabaja todos los días de la semana, para mantener y cuidar a su familia, también se hace cargo del pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, y educación de su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para  aumentar su capital de trabajo al que se dedica en la comercialización de cosméticos y comprar más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
El sueño de Patricia es poder contar con una tienda de venta de cosméticos  y ayudar a   mejorar su calidad de vida a su hijo en sus estudios.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Patricia’s single and has a school-age son.  She lives in an apartment with a living room, bedroom, kitchen and bath.  The apartment is brick with cement floors and is located in the city of La Paz’s El Rosario zone.

Currently, Patricia works as an employee in a private institution; she works in general customer relations and in the evenings works selling cosmetics of the Esika and Yanval brands.  She works every day of the week in order to support and care for her family.  She’s responsible for her son’s utility, food, dress and education costs.    Patricia’s dream is being able to have a cosmetics shop and to help improve her son’s quality of life by means of his education.  This is the first time she’s requested credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her welding shop.
Rizalina has been in this business for 11 years. Rizalina also earns additional income from a general store.
Rizalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 45 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have been farming maize for 19 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and to pay labor costs for getting enough maize returns. The profits from the farming will be used to buy more land to use for farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.
